alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Jasper; Lauderdale (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 9:52AM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Jasper, northern Clarke and southeastern Lauderdale Counties through 1030 AM CST... At 952 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Orange, or 11 miles west of Quitman, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Quitman and Stonewall around 1005 AM CST. Sable around 1010 AM CST. Middleton and Sykes around 1015 AM CST. Snell around 1025 AM CST. Other locations impacted by this storm include Pachuta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 PM CST for east central Mississippi.
